creditline: The Ethel Morrison Van Derlip Fund
description: Giovanni Volpato, Europa and the Bull,Bisque, ceramic-porcelain, Italian, XVIII c. cat. card dims 10-1/2 x 9-1/4 x 7-1/4'; no photo. on card; neg. no. 14-265.1.4
markings: impressed at top of base at back edge: [G. Volpato Roma.]
text: This sculpture depicts the famous mythological tale in which Jupiter transforms himself into a bull to carry away the young, beautiful Europa.  Cupid runs along side the bull.  The only other known version of this subject is at the Cini Collection of the Musei Capitolini in Rome.
title: Europa and the Bull
